document.title: CONTINUED DISPARITIES IN SCHOOL FACILITIES: ANALYZING BROWN V. BOARD OF EDUCATION’S SINGULAR APPROACH TO QUALITY EDUCATION
document.publication-title: Tennessee Journal of Race, Gender, & Social Justice

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Attorney at the Law Office of Corsica D. Smith. J.D. 2014, American University Washington College of Law; B.A. 2010, Brown University. I would like to thank Professor Lia Epperson for her comments on earlier drafts and the Tennessee Journal of Race, Gender & Social Justice staff for their efforts in editing and preparing my article for publication. I, also, would to thank my family and friends for their encouragement and patience during the writing of this article.

field.name: short_title
field.value: CONTINUED DISPARITIES IN SCHOOL FACILITIES: ANALYZING BROWN V. BOARD OF EDUCATION’S SINGULAR APPROACH TO QUALITY EDUCATION
